result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia Joanne Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cynthia Joanne Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cynthia Joanne Smith was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today December 12, 2014.
Bond continues until signed up for Probation.
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant may request early release from Probation after 2 successful years.
Court notes 17 days credit against ultimate sentence.


 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

signed by Def. & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF:  Cynthia Joanne Smith appeared. Includes 14CF6 and 14CF451. Court reads charge and maximum penalties to count 5 (possess meth) in 14CF6 and count 2 (bail jump) in 14CF451. DE pleads guilty to Ct 5 in 14CF6 and Ct 2 in 14CF451. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 5 in 14CF6 and Ct 2 in 14CF451. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Cts 1, 2, 3 and 4 in 14CF6 and cts 1 & 3 in 14CF451. Sentencing recommendations. A PSI is not recommended. 
Crt orders: S/W 3 years probation with conditions: Ct 5 in 14CF6 and CT2 in 14CF451 are concurrent; without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of revocation. Compass evaluation to be provided to probation.
- Court costs $518.00 (ct 5 in 14CF6)
- Court costs $518.00 (ct 2 in 14CF451)
- AODA and follow all recommendations. It is noted defendant has this completed and is currently following recommendations. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court authorizes MRT if agent deems appropriate.
- 6 months STAYED to be used at the discretion of probation agent.
- Complete any parenting program probation agent deems necessary
Apply bond on file
RE: 14CF451 17 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
Defendant to report to probation today. Bond continues until signed up.
Defendant may request early release of probation after 2 years of successful participation.
c: Def & Atty. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Carey, ADA: A Hahn, DF ATTY: Dan Ferkus for Brian Smestad, DF: Cynthia Joanne Smith appeared from jail.  Set for FPT on 14CF6, JT scheduled for 12/22/14.  Def's new case, 14CF451 brought in for reference.  ADA Hahn advises that they have worked out an agreement with Atty Smestad to settle both files, def is completing drug court application, requests date in 2 weeks.  Def amends address, consistent in both files.  ADA Hahn advises def has provided a prescription so they will not be filing new charges.  Court orders def be released, bond conditions continue as set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 08:00 am.
for Release/Modification/Change in Sentence filed by Defendant. UNSIGNED. eif

SIGNATURE BOND:  Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1500.00.

-Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-DE to update current address when reporting for testing.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-DE to baseline test prior to release.


**BOND AMENDED**
